title: Mauricio Pochettino: Tottenham's Erik Lamela may not play again this season
text:
Friday 10 March 2017 13:48 GMT Click to followES Sport Lamela has been out of action since late October Getty Images 
Mauricio Pochettino today admitted he could not guarantee that Erik Lamela would play for Tottenham again this season. 
Lamela, the club’s £30million record signing, has not featured for Spurs since the 2-1 defeat at Liverpool in the EFL Cup on October 25. 
As well as a hip injury, Lamela returned to Argentina briefly due to a family matter, and also spent some time with former club Roma at the start of the year as part of his rehabilitation. 
Tottenham’s official injury update said Lamela “continues to work outdoors and is now stepping up his rehabilitation”. But Pochettino was more forthcoming. Tottenham expect Danny Rose to return from knee injury in early April 
The Tottenham manager said Lamela’s off-field issues were no longer affecting his progress, insisting that the hip injury was the only problem holding him back. 
But when asked how much longer Lamela might be absent, Pochettino replied: “I don’t want to lie to you and give some information that after you use, you are right to use.
